result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin K. Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Homicide by Negligent Operation/Vehicle, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.10(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 10/13/17 to indicate defendant to submit a DNA sample to State Crime Lab for DNA Analysis.
***Amended 3/19/18 to adjust restitution amounts ordered.  See Assessment Report and Order Attached.

miscConds.notes: ***Amended 3/19/18 to adjust restitution amounts ordered.  See Assessment Report and Order Attached.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol unless she has completed the AODA and her Agent gives written approval of the same.  The Court will not find in violation if defendant has a job as a waitress.
Defendant to not operate a motor vehicle with any detectable level of restricted controlled substances in her system.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless authorized to do so by MVD.

Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant to possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by her physician.
Defendant shall obtain all medications from 1 pharmacy and must report any new medications to her Agent within 72 hours.
**Amended 10/13/17 to indicate defendant to submit a DNA sample to State Crime Lab for DNA Analysis.
Defendant to participate in an AODA assessment and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed 2 1/2 months, to be utilized by her Agent upon application to the Court.
To serve 6 months straight condition time with work release privileges.
To serve an additional 9 days each year without work release privileges.  To serve each Memorial Day weekend, July 2-4, and Labor Day weekend in county jail during the 5 years of probation. Time is considered straight time with no work release privileges.
Defendant may serve in any county jail.
Defendant to report to Waupaca Co. Huber officer today.  Her conditional jail time sentence commencement date is left up to the Huber Officer and her Agent.

Court questions counsel re:  RHT request.
Statements by Ms. Carlson.
Imposed & stayed - 7 years total WI Prison - 3 years IC and 4 ES - the Court places def. on probation for 5 years.
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action + RHT surcharge. 
2.  pay RHT as reflected on RHT summary.
3.  pay supervision fees.
4.  def. to participate in an AODA & follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
5.  def. to participate in any other assessments as directed by her Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
6.  def. to not possess or consume any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
7.  def. to possess prescription only with a valid prescription and take in manner & method as prescribed by her physician.
8.  def. to obtain all medications from 1 pharmacy and must report any new medications to her Agent w/in 72 hours.
9.  def. to not possess or consume any alcohol unless she has completed the AODA and her Agent gives written approval of the same.  The court will not find a violation if def. has a job as a waitress. 
10.  def. to not operate a MV with any detectable level of restricted controlled substances in her system.
11.  def. to not operate a MV unless authorized to do so by MVD.
12.  def. to serve each Memorial Day weekend, July 2-4, and Labor Day weekend in co jail during her 5 years of probation - time is considered straight time w/no WR privileges.
13.  def. to serve a total of 10 months in co jail - stayed 2 1/2 months to be utilized by her Agent upon application to the Court - 6 months straight condition time w/WR privileges and additional 9 days each year (as specified above, which totals 45 days) w/o WR privileges - def. may serve in any county jail  - def. to report to Waupaca Co Huber officer today - her condition jail sentence commencement date is left up to Huber officer and her Agent.
14.  def. to perform 400 hours of CSW. 
Atty. Seifert requests Ex. #1 be sealed by the court - the Court directs Ex. #1 be sealed.
